intro: Fordia johorensis, commonly known as the Johore Fordia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in tropical and subtropical climates. Fordia johorensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
